titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Morse Family Papers: William Reginald and Anne Crosse Kinney Morse
Morse Family Papers: William Reginald and Anne Crosse Kinney Morse
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Morgan Gagne and Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:15

did.unittitle: Morse Family Papers: William Reginald and Anne Crosse Morse
did.abstract: Medical missionary William Reginald Morse and his wife Anne (Anna) Crosse Kinney Morse served under the American Baptist Foreign Mission Society in China from 1909 to 1937. Substantive correspondence describes the daily life and work of the Morses, their travels, medical practice and education in China, and the turbulent political and social situation in China during this era. The Morses were based primarily Chengdu, Sichuan Province and at the West China Union University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased in cooperation with the Harvey Cushing/John Hay Medical Library of Yale University in 2014.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Morse Family Papers: William Reginald and Anna Crosse Kinney Morse (RG 265), Special Collections, Yale Divinity Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Morse Family Papers acquired by Yale in 2014 have been divided into two sections. The Morse Family Papers: William Reginald Morse and Anna Crosse Kinney Morse are held by the Yale Divinity Library while the Morse Family Papers: Marjorie Morse and Photographs are held by the Medical Historical Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dr. William Reginald Morse (1874-1939) was born August 30, 1874 in Lawrencetown, Nova Scotia, Canada, the son of Ellen Marry Fitch and Leander Rupert Morse. He received his medical degree from McGill University in 1902 and later did postgraduate work at Harvard University, Johns Hopkins University, and the University College of London, receiving a B.A., M.D., C.M, F.A.C.S., L.L.D, and F.R.G.S.

Dr. Morse practiced medicine in Rhode Island and Nova Scotia before being appointed in 1909 as medical missionary to China serving under the American Baptist Foreign Mission Society with his wife, Anna Crosse Kinney Morse (1875-1951), whom he had married in 1903. The Morses had one daughter, Marjorie, born in 1913.

Upon arrival in China the Morses traveled to Sichuan Province, West China, where Dr. Morse worked at a small missionary hospital for a few years. In 1914 Morse was sent to the provincial capital, Chengdu, where he helped found a medical school at West China Union University, an institution supported by various Protestant mission agencies. He was elected as Dean of the WCUU Medical School in 1919, Director of the College of Medicine and Dentistry in 1935, and was Professor of Anatomy and Surgery at West China Union University until his retirement in 1937. Dr. Morse also held positions at the Baptist College, and the Methodist Hospital in Chengdu. He served at the Hankow International Hospital during the revolution of 1911-1912 and at Lingnan University in Canton from 1927 to 1928.

In addition to his medical practice, Morse published five works relating to the history and practice of medicine in China and Tibet, including "The Practices and Principles of Chinese Medicine" and "A Memorandum on the Chinese Procedure of Acupuncture" in 1926. His major work was "The Three Crosses In The Purple Mists;: An Adventure In Medical Education Under The Eaves Of The Roof Of The World", published in 1928. Morse also did research and writing in the field of anthropology, publishing, for example an article titled "Schedule of Physical Anthropological Measurements and Observations on Ten Ethnic Groups of Szechwan Province, West China" in the Journal of the West China Border Research Society in 1937. Morse was the first president of the West China Border Research Society, and did much to maintain interest in its growth and development. He served as a research associate at the Peabody Museum at Harvard University in 1930-1931.
Dr. Morse passed away in the United States in November 1939.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection provides valuable documentation of the life and work of medical missionary William Reginald Morse and his wife Anne (Anna) Crosse Kinney Morse, who served under the American Baptist Foreign Mission Society in China from 1909 to 1937. Very detailed and substantive correspondence describes the daily life and work of the Morses, their travels, and the turbulent political and social situation in China during this era. Based primarily Chengdu, Sichuan Province and at the West China Union University, the Morses also spent time in Shanghai and other areas.

The Morse Family Papers acquired by Yale in 2014 have been divided into two sections. This collection at the Yale Divinity LIbrary includes papers of William Reginald Morse and Anna Crosse Kinney Morse while the Morse Family Papers: Marjorie Morse and Photographs are held by the Medical Historical Library.

The first series, Family Correspondence, includes many multi-paged letters from Dr. and Mrs. Morse to relatives in Nova Scotia and, after 1927, to their daughter Marjorie (born in 1913 in China) while she was attending an American high school, Wellesley College, and Yale Nursing School. These letters describe events such as the Morse family's 1909 initial long trip, traveling 1,800 miles inland from Shanghai, perilous travels by boat and by train, assistance to rural Chinese and military casualties caused by the fighting between Chinese warlords, the growth of Communism, and the Morses' religious, professional, and social interactions with the overall missionary and Chinese Christian community.
The second series, General Correspondence, includes primarily letters of condolence written to Anna Morse following the death of Dr. Morse in November 1939.

The third series, Writings and Notes, includes papers written by Dr. Morse including a medical report, two articles, and an essay regarding Chinese medicine and his medical work. This series also includes a book review of Morse's work "The Three Crosses in the Purple Mist" and several handwritten notes.
The fourth series, Personal Items and Memorabilia, includes biographical documentation regarding Dr. Morse, a friendship calendar with notes and photographs from supporters, and other memorabilia.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

did.unittitle: Family Correspondence
W. R. Morse (WRM) and Anne Crosse Kinney Morse (ACM) to Mother and Rose en route to China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: William Reginald Morse was known as "Reg" and Anne Crosse Kinney Morse was known as "Anna". Letters describe travel to China and exploration of new scenes and cities.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Shanghai, boat on Yangtze River, Ichang
WRM to Mother from boat on Yangtze River, Chungking (Chongqing)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including description of operation of houseboat WRM is traveling on, landslides in the Yangtze River, Chinese language study, and WRM's medical work on passengers and workers aboard

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother and Rose from boat on Yangtze River, Suifu (Yibin)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including description of treatment of patients along the way to Suifu, arrival in Suifu, and the beginning of WRM's Chinese language study.

did.unittitle: ACM to Mother and Rose from Chungking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arrival in China, plans for house.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Descriptions of Chinese people, homes, customs, and WRM's anxiety to learn the Chinese language and begin hospital work.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including description of WRM and ACM's move into new house, Chinese customs (such as clothing, women's bound feet, and ancestral worship), and WRM's visit to his teacher's home.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu, Chungking summer bungalow

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM's visits to patients, learning of Chinese medical remedies, and move to summer bungalow.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Chungking summer bungalow

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Severe storm damage to bungalows, Chinese wedding and feasts, and continuation of language study.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother and Walter from Chungking, Ichang

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Weather in China (overwhelming heat and insects), WRM's attendance at a childbirth, WRM and ACM's 26-day travel from Chungking to Ichang.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother and Lew from Chungking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Death and funeral of a Chinese Christian evangelist: the transportation of his body to his home, Chinese ancestor worship in graveyard, and Chinese feast.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Chungking, Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM and ACM move back to Suifu from summer bungalow in Chungking, visit a wildlife park and salt mine.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu, boat on Yangtze River, Chungking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes description of the failing health of fellow missionary Dr. Lewis, WRM's escort of Lewis' family to Chungking, and WRM's visits to Chinese hospitals and British gunboat.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from boat on Yangtze River, Ichang, Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two-week return trip by houseboat to Suifu, the one-year anniversary of WRM's "active service" in China, river trip with a missionary and native evangelist, and return to Suifu.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu, Yachow

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM and ACM on 10-day trip to Yachow for a conference; description of Chinese hotels and travel on river, and Chinese New Year customs.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Yachow, Chengtu (Chengdu), boat on Chengtu River

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM meeting with other missionaries, talk of some missions combining hospital work and religious work, and hospitality in Chengtu (Chengdu)

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM's return to Suifu, Chinese-language study and medical work, the death of the missionary Salquist from typhoid fever, and a shortage of workers.

did.unittitle: ACM to Mother and Rose from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Description of gifts that were sent to WRM and ACM from ACM's family, book recommendations for ACM's family, and life in the countryside of China.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding weather in China and problems with getting supplies.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to Mother from Chungking summer bungalow, Kiating

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Daily life at summer bungalow in Chungking, trip to Kiating (Leshan), and the treatment of patients in Kiating.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu, Chungking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding government unrest and missionaries' removal to Chungking and Shanghai. WRM granted permission to stay in Chungking to work in hospitals, anxious to get back to Chengtu.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother and Walter from Chungking, Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rebellion brings death to many Chinese, many missionaries forced to move but WRM able to stay in Chungking.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to Mother from Ichang, Hankow (Wuhan)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM's removal from Chungking station by British Consul, arrival in Hankow, and destruction of the city. WRM working with the Red Cross at Hankow International Hospital.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Hankow, Shanghai

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding the ending of WRM's work at Hankow International Hospital, temporary travel to Shanghai, and WRM turning down an offer to care for the wounded and famished at a hospital along the line of TienTsui Pakow Railway.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to Mother from Shanghai

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM attending a language school in Shanghai. Missionaries receive appeal to volunteer for distribution food for famine relief; WRM joins this effort

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Shanghai, Kuling

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM leaving Shanghai, river trip to Kuling (Lushan District), and resort in Kuling.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to Rose, Lew, and Mother from Shanghai

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding WRM and ACM's celebration of ninth anniversary of marriage and ACM's medical emergency and eventual recovery from kidney problem.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Kuling, boat on the Yangtze River, Chungking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including description of Anna's pregnancy and improvement of pregnancy complications, arrival in Chungking to help Dr. McCartney, and WRM's medical courses.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Ichang, boat on Yangtze River, Chungking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM's travels from Ichang to Chungking (on the way to Suifu) and unsatisfactory conditions on boat.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from boat on Yangtze River, Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM arrives in Suifu, reassembles servants, does necessary repairs on house and hospital, prepares to open a dispensary

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to Mother from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes the continuation of hospital repairs, WRM's busy dispensary and interactions with dispensary patients, and the birth of daughter, Marjorie Morse, on February 24, 1913.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding WRM's work with patients in hospital and dispensary and an unusual request from the Cabinet of the New China Republic for prayers that virtuous men be elected and that government be established on a firm foundation.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Continued work at hospital and dispensary; WRM pleased by visit from the officers of a British gunboat in port.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Amidst political unrest and tension in China, ACM and Marjorie visit the "hills", WRM continues his hospital work.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rebellion in area crushed for a time; hospital full.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu, Chungking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM's happiness with his profession, growing fondness towards Marjorie, preparations for conference and thoughts about medical school

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Chungking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM turns 40 years old, satisfied with large amounts of work (over 300 operations). He expresses sadness and excitement towards leaving the hospital and going to medical school for new opportunities.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Chungking, Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Political unrest in China, WRM's treatment of patients who were victims of violence, ACM's illness and recovery, and the celebration of WRM and ACM's eleventh wedding anniversary.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to Mother from Chungking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM's continues his hospital work. Description of summer weather and a growing foreign population in China, and WRM's urge to volunteer as a doctor in the European war.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to Mother from Suifu, Kiating, boat on the Fu River, Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including description of life in Suifu and the positive experiences of ACM and WRM, WRM waiting to hear back from the medical school, French and German soldiers going off to battle, and the Morse family settling in Chengtu.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu, Kiating

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM recommended by the hospital Reference Committee for a teaching position at the West China Union University's Medical Department, the meeting of WRM and ACM's mothers in Brooklyn, and ACM starting to teach English to Chinese students.

did.unittitle: WRM to Mother from Suifu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding the start of WRM's work conference, Chinese tensions with Japan and the United States growing larger, and WRM's thoughts towards enlisting in the war in Europe.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to Mother from Chengtu, Shanghai

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes description of WRM's travels in China, the physical changes of WRM and ACM since their arrival in China. WRM now the only foreign teacher in the West China Union University anatomy department.

did.unittitle: ACM to Mother from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: ACM makes suggestions to mother about how to make life easier and describes Chinese nature, Chinese life, and her meeting at the Natural History Club.

did.unittitle: ACM to Mother from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: ACM's life at home and with friends while WRM is away on a trip, encloses letter written by a Mrs. Humphrey about WRM and his life in China.

did.unittitle: ACM, WRM, and Marjorie Morse (MM) to Mother from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes events in the lives of ACM and MM and WRM's travel to Peking.

did.unittitle: ACM and WRM to Mother and Elsie from Chengtu, Shanghai

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: ACM worried about the amount of work that WRM is taking on, WRM's thoughts about leaving China for England, life with MM and work at the medical school; ACM teaching English and Drawing classes.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Shanghai, Canton, Hong Kong

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes the Morse family's move from Shanghai to Canton, daily hospital work and domestic life, MM beginning high school, WRM and ACM living in separate places, growing tensions between Chinese and foreign missionaries.

did.unittitle: ACM to MM from Canton, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Seoul, Onseiri

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes the daily life events of WRM and ACM, WRM and ACM's travels and life events to and in Shanghai, Hong Kong, Seoul, and Onseiri.

did.unittitle: WRM to MM from Canton, Shanghai, Seoul, Onseiri

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM writing a book about the history of the Chengdu Medical School, WRM and ACM's celebration of their twenty-fifth anniversary of marriage, continued medical work, and travels to Shanghai, Hong Kong, Seoul, and Onseiri.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Onseiri, Shanghai, Peking, Chungking, Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding WRM's book, political tensions and unrest in China, ACM's art exhibition opening, and the Morse family's travels and cultural experiences in Shanghai, Hong Kong, Peking, Seoul, and Onseiri.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu, Onseiri, train to Mukden, Shanghai, boat on the Yangtze River, Chungking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM and ACM's journey across China, Manchuria, and Korea, political tensions between the Chinese and the Japanese, and summer weather and daily events.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes the passing of MM's Aunt Rose, severe fighting and assaults on steamers in China, MM's sixteenth birthday, WRM's work as a teacher in anatomy department, and his writing of a research paper about Chinese medicine.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding publication and reviews for WRM's book "The Three Crosses in the Purple Mists", MM's college entrance examinations and induction into the National Honor Society, and WRM and ACM's recovery from bad health.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Beh Liu Din, Lifan, Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding college recommendations for MM, WRM's travel to Lifan and life in Lifan, ACM teaching classes.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu, boat on the Min River, boat on the Yangtze River, Shanghai, Madras

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM reducing his time at hospitals and only taking on special medical cases, making preparations for travel back to America.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Madras, train to Benares, Bombay, boat on the Red Sea

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including description of the people and customs of Madras and Bombay, dates and deadlines for arriving in Bombay and Egypt's Port Said, and WRM and ACM's excitement of getting home to MM.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from boat to Cairo, Cairo, the steamer S.S. Laurentic, Paris, London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes a smallpox outbreak on WRM and ACM's ferry, sightseeing in Cairo, Egyptian people and customs, WRM getting asked to make a class speech at a college commencement

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM visits London hospitals and the Medical Museum of the Royal College of Surgeons, travel in United Kingdom

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu, in U.S on train en route to Detroit, Chicago, Evanston, the Rockies, Ontario, S.S. Empress of Russia boat en route to Yokohama, Shanghai

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM and ACM's happiness towards MM's success at school, MM starting at Wellesley College, WRM and ACM's railway travels to Detroit, Chicago, Vancouver, and Ontario to visit family and see scenery, MM starting college, and WRM and ACM's experiences in Japan.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Shanghai, boat on the Yangtze River, Chungking, boat on the Min River, Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including description of WRM's excitement to help people in medical need, meetings of the National Christian Council, effects of the flood of the Yangtze on Chinese homes and people, legal trouble with Chinese travel customs.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM's home and work experiences in Chengtu and at the West China Union University; WRM acting as the president of the West China Border Research Society and giving a lecture on acupuncture; special operations conducted at the hospital, and the tensions of the Sino-Japanese situation in Shanghai.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding tensions between Chinese and Japanese; ACM teaching painting classes and WRM teaching at the university, meetings with foreign missionaries, and MM's college life and curriculum.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Beh Liu Tin, Chengtu, Canton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM's writing on anatomy and anthropological measurements, the outbreak of cholera in China, WRM and ACM's registration with the Chinese government, and WRM publishing work for the Peabody Museum at Harvard University.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM has large amount of hospital work, including treatment of wounded soldiers.

did.unittitle: WRM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes troubles arising in the United States, China, Europe, and Russia, WRM working on different reports and lectures, the illness and health improvement of WRM's colleague Dr. Lenox, and Chinese spring weather and seasonal customs.

did.unittitle: WRM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding uprisings of Communism in the north-east and the eastern sections of the Szechuan province, MM's college examinations, China's election of a new president (Chang), the defeat in power of the warlord Liu Wen Hwei at Chengtu, and the temporary end of the Chinese Civil War.

did.unittitle: WRM to MM from Chengtu, Seung Pan, Beh Lin Tin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes the departure of the warlord Liu Wen Hwei from the city of Chengtu, the effects of the war-like conditions on normal citizens

did.unittitle: WRM to MM from Beh Liu Tin, Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding the beginning of MM's final undergraduate year at Wellesley College and her worries about her future, WRM's large classes in Anatomy and Surgery at the university, and the growth of Communism in China.

did.unittitle: WRM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes a German Government official visit to China, the rise of the Communist party and WRM's fears regarding Communist success in Chinese government, financial and legal issues in the Chinese government, and WRM and ACM's holiday celebrations and plans.

did.unittitle: ACM to MM from Chengtu, Peu Hsien

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes ACM's travel to and time in Peu Hsien, her support of MM's college work and future experiences, ACM's sketch and artwork processes, and daily life in Chengtu.

did.unittitle: ACM to MM from Chengtu, Bei Liu Tin (Bei Lu Din)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including description of nature and scenery that ACM comes across during the summer season, her meetings with the Fine Arts Committee, military affairs, art exhibition openings, the devastation of an earthquake, and life events in Bei Lu Din and Chengtu.

did.unittitle: WRM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM's advice to MM for her future profession, WRM resigning from the Deanship of medicine in order to have more freedom, MM filing legal papers for American citizenship, and WRM's report writing for the College of Medicine and Dentistry.

did.unittitle: WRM to MM from Shih Men Kan, Beh Liu Tin, Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding WRM's travels across the Szechuan province, characteristics and customs of the Miao people of China, WRM's thoughts on turning 60 years old, pressures at work, the growing reality of the Communist troubles in China, and MM's new experiences with working.

did.unittitle: ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes political tensions in China, WRM's success with his lecture presentations, MM's commencement from Wellesley College, and the daily life events of ACM and MM.

did.unittitle: ACM to MM from Beh Liu Tin, Chengtu, Hong Kong

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding WRM's trip across Szechuan province, rainstorms in Chengtu, warm weather, and events that ACM attends.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including description of unrest in China and resistance towards the Communist party, mail deliveries from foreign countries being held up and eventually coming through to China, WRM's optimism towards new medical students joining his classes in the face of Chinese Communism, and WRM's views on missionary work.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM and ACM's work with students and art exhibitions, visits with guests, housework developments and changes, worries and conflicts arise with the "Reds", WRM dropping out of office during the university's elections

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu, Yachow, Shin Kai Si

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding MM's wedding engagement, WRM and ACM celebrating their 32nd wedding anniversary, the Nanking government requesting information from WRM and ACM, a lecture by Professor Weigle of the Yale Divinity School in Yachow, and WRM working on a paper called "The Ancient Aboriginal Tribes of Szechuan."

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from boat on the Min River, Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM's happiness at MM's engagement and enthusiasm for work, the initiation of new members into the Christian Church Council, WRM's teaching processes of Anatomy and Surgery, and the death of the Morse family's friend Mrs. Williams.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes the meetings of the United Church of Canada, the spread of communism to the living areas of Chinese tribes, Chinese students against Japan, earthquakes that have occurred in Szechuan province, and a sketch of where communism has spread in the Szechuan province.

did.unittitle: ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including regarding ACM's city visits and visits with friends, painting, WRM and ACM giving students examinations, typhoon damages to Chinese houses.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes MM's attendance at the Yale-Harvard football game, the annual West China Border Research Society conference at Chengtu, changes in Chinese culture and marriage customs, and WRM and ACM's visits with colleagues and friends.

did.unittitle: WRM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Incluidng regarding the deaths of two friends of the Morse family, WRM's invitation to a conference for all of the Deans and Principals of the Medical College in China, MM receiving a letter from the president of the "Yale-in-China" Medical School (Edward H. Hume), Communists who are continually active, and political unrest in China.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Kiating, Nanking, Chengtu, Beh Liu Tin, Miao country

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes WRM's time in Nanking as part of a trip conducted by the West China Union University and its medical college, MM contracting scarlet fever, WRM elected as director of the medical college of the West China Union University, and summer weather in Chengtu, Miao country, and Beh Liu Tin.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: WRM giving up hospital work and his position as director of the medical college in order to focus on anatomy and anthropology, Chinese feasts and customs for the start of the spring season, and a recipe for a Chinese meal.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu, Peu Hsien

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes government requirements for colleges and college classes, the customs and events of the Chinese Republic anniversary holiday "Double Truth Day", the Chinese goverment's set of counter-demands to Japan, and autumn weather in China.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from boat en route to Singapore, Colombo, London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Incluidng description of the physical conditions of WRM and ACM, monotonous travel to Singapore by steamer boat, WRM trying to rewrite a paper on the blood groups of the Chinese Miao tribe, MM's wedding plans, participation in activities on a steamer boat to London, and WRM and ACM's positive experiences in London.

did.unittitle: WRM and ACM to MM from Chengtu, Chungking, Ichang, boat on the Yangtze River, Shanghai

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes the health recovery of WRM, WRM and ACM giving away many of their household items, WRM staying at home in order to rest and regain his health, MM's wedding date is planned and set, and travels to Chungking, Ichang, and Shanghai.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles Included: "Opportunities for Graduate Work in West China" (Published in the Chinese Recorder," October, 1932); "An Expedition into the Chwan Miao Country: A Vacation with a Purpose" (Published in the W.C.U. Newsletter, October, 1936)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published in the West China Missionary News, written by "J.T."
